name: potentiometer production, unspecified | potentiometer, unspecified | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7753/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of a typical potentiometer. It is based on the assumption that a typical potentiometer in electronic module has an average weight of 6.1 g.The data represent a typical potentiometer, used in the information and communication technology. Material data are taken from the literature. Infrastructure and production efforts are based on own assumptions. The production efforts represent not a specific resistor type and have thus, accordingly higher uncertainties.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of metals, plastics at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw material input and production efforts for the production of potentiometers (the variable resistor type).
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent a global valuable composition of potentiometers.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology for the production of resistors and potentiometers - comprising terminmation printing; resistive body printing; glass coat printing; laser trimming; substrate stripping (SMT) resp. ceramic rods; deposition processes; ageing; capping (THT) resp. printing; curing; punching; revetting; molding (ptoentiom.)

exchanges.description:
Potentiometer here is considered as an example of a variable resistor, an average/typical trim potentiometer, like used in the information and communication technology (e.g. television production), is represented here as the fourth type of resistors. The potentiometer then is "a variable resistor that can be used as a voltage divider". Hence, it describes an electrical device which has a user-adjustable resistance. Usually, this is a three-terminal resistor with a sliding contact in the center. If all three terminals are used, it can act as a variable voltage divider. If only two terminals are used (one side and the wiper), it acts as a variable resistor.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO

flow.name: potentiometer, unspecified
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Calculated Value. The production of 1 kg of resistors lead to a waste amount of 0.23 kg unused raw materials. Hence, this dataset here has an input of 1.23 kg of raw materials per kg of resistor. The split to the different raw materials (metals, plastics, etc.) is based on the reported  material specifications.
